DOC.brief_summary: The aim of this epidemiologic prospective study is to determine the prevalence of CPSP defined as pain occurring 4 months after scoliosis and thoracic surgery and rated > 3 on a 10 point visual analogue scale or FLACC scale, in children aged from 6 to 18 years. The main objective : prevalence of chronic post surgical pain 4 months after scoliosis ant thoracic surgery in children aged 6 to 18 years. The secondary objectives: the intensity of chronic post surgical pain, the prevalence of neuropathic syndrome and the predictive risk factors.
DOC.brief_title: Chronic Pain After Scoliosis and Thoracic Surgery in Children
DOC.criteria: children aged from 6 to 18 years undergoing scoliosis or thoracic surgery in paediatric Bordeaux hospital. patients who not willing to participate, with children and/or parental insufficient understanding of the questionnaires.
